thread.title: Local roundup: Coast Guard football stays unbeaten in league
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Coast Guard football stays unbeaten in league

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Coast Guard football stays unbeaten in league
text: • H.S. boys roundup: Comeback allows NFA soccer to snap 5-game slide... NEW LONDON — Mike Clancy ran for a career-high 134 yards and a touchdown and quarterback Derek Victory ran for a score and threw for another as Coast Guard Academy defeated MIT, 28-13, on Homecoming Weekend to remain unbeaten in the New England Football Conference. Clancy ran for 106 yards in the second half as the Bears (4-2, 3-0) held MIT scoreless after halftime. Coast Guard ran for a season-high 204 yards and won their third straight for the first time since 2007. Victory was 13-for-24 passing for 168 yards. He threw a touchdown pass to Kyle Jackson and ran for a 1-yard score on a 4th-down play in the second quarter. Joe Rizzardi returned an interception for a score in the first quarter to get Coast Guard on the board. The Bears play at Curry at 1 p.m. Saturday. MEN’S SOCCER UConn 2 UCF 1 STORRS — Jake Nerwinski broke a tie in the 80th minute and the Huskies earned their first American Athletic Conference win of the season. Abdou Thiam also scored and Kwame Awvah had both assists for UConn (4-5-4, 1-3-1). Mitchell 7 Becker 0 NEW LONDON — NFA graduate Andris Vital scored two goals and the Mariners won in a rout. Waterford alum Yianni Longinidis and Bacon Academy boys soccer coach Andrew Storton also scored for Mitchell (7-5-1, 4-0 New England Collegiate Conference) and Wheeler alum TJ Condon added an assist. ECSU 4 Southern Maine 0 GORHAM, Maine — Xavier Doran recorded a hat trick and the Warriors increased their winning streak to three. Alejandro Tobon scored his first goal of the season and Justin Jensen recorded two assists for Eastern (11-2-1, 3-0-1 Little East). WOMEN’S SOCCER ECSU 4 Southern Maine 0 WILLIMANTIC — Lyman Memorial alum Joanna Weir scored her first goal of the season and added an assist to help the Warriors win their third straight game. Woodstock Academy alum Emily Becher scored her team-leading 11th goal for Eastern Connecticut State (10-3-1, 5-0 Little East). Hailey Lehning and Anna Manser also scored. WOMEN’S ICE HOCKEY UConn 4 Syracuse 3 STORRS — Theresa Knutson scored late in the third period to give the Huskies their first win of the season. After falling behind 2-0, Justine Fredette and Madison Badeau scored 16 seconds apart to tie the game in the first period. Syracuse regained the lead in the second, Jordy Zacharias pulled UConn (1-1-1) even with a goal 49 seconds later. Page 2 of 2 - FIELD HOCKEY UConn 1 Old Dominion 0 STORRS — The second-ranked Huskies posted their sixth consecutive shutout to remain unbeaten. Amelia Iacobucci scored in the first half to give UConn (14-0, 3-0 Big East) all the offense it would need. Nina Klein made three saves for the shutout. VOLLEYBALL Warriors split pair NORTON, Mass. — Eastern Connecticut State defeated Rhode Island College (22-25, 25-16, 20-25, 25-22, 15-11) but followed it up with a loss to host Wheaton, 3-0 (25-16, 25-19, 25-21). In the first match, Adrianna Mihalek totaled 20 kills and 14 digs and Allie Luppi dished out 25 assists for the Warriors (11-12). In the second match, Waterford alum Amanda Tourjee had a team-high 14 assists to go along with five digs. By The Bulletin
